p: An individual application of Combretum erythrophyllum ethyl acetate, Quercus acutissima ethyl acetate and Melia azedarach acetone extracts showed antifungal activity of more than 50% inhibition against F. proliferatum ( Figure 1). However, their corresponding different solvent extractions were less active (â‰¤50% inhibition) against the same pathogen. The combined application of C. erythrophyllum and Q. acutissima acetone extract showed a somewhat synergistic antifungal activity (66.9% inhibition), against F. proliferatum. There was no significant difference in terms of antifungal activity observed between the positive control (97.1% inhibition) and M. azedarach acetone extract (97.1% inhibition) against F. proliferatum ( Figure 1).
